abstract: Gabriel Iván Heinze (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈeinse]; born 19 April 1978) is an Argentine professional footballer who plays for Newell's Old Boys. He can operate as either a left or central defender.Nicknamed Gringo ("Blonde" in Argentine-Spanish slang), he made a name for himself at Paris Saint-Germain, moving in 2004 to Manchester United and subsequently to Real Madrid, winning three major titles with the latter two clubs.Heinze played 72 times with Argentina, representing the nation at two World Cups and as many Copa América tournaments.
comment: Gabriel Iván Heinze (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈeinse]; born 19 April 1978) is an Argentine professional footballer who plays for Newell's Old Boys.
